item.title: 2025 Fall Tournament results
item.dc:creator: Steve
item.description:
Thank you to everyone who came out to participate in our first Fall Tournament. With a great turnout of 20 players there is clearly a demand so our intention is to make this an annual event just like our Spring Tournament.

The winners were Axyl Schulz in the C division, Micheal Hsu in the B division and Robert Hu in the A division.

Our usual shout out to Brentwood Co-Op for allowing us to use their community room free of charge.

Stay tuned for our Spring Tournament coming in May!

item.title: Fire at Central Library, Sept 14 meeting unaffected
item.dc:creator: Steve
item.description:
There's been a fire at the Central Library.

However, the fire has been contained and the Calgary Library website reports that the Central Library will reopen as usual on Sunday. So the September 14 meeting is unaffected.

item.title: 2025 Fall Tournament October 5, no club meeting
item.dc:creator: Steve
item.description:
A year is a long time between tournaments, so the Calgary Go Club is hosting a Fall tournament for 2025. It will take place on October 5th.

Note that because of the tournament there will be no club meeting on October 5th.

Location: Calgary Co-op Brentwood
4122 Brentwood Rd NW
View Map
Date and Time: Sunday October 5th (9:00 AM to about 6:30 PM)
Registration: Email Vincent at studentofsmith@gmail.com with your name and rank (if known)
Entry fee: NONE!
Co-op does not charge us for use of the community room, so we have negligible costs to run the tournament.
So come have some fun and play some games!
Prizes: Fame and glory!

The tournament will have a round-robin format with 6 players per division (five rounds). Whoever has the most wins in a division will be the winner of that division. In the event of a tie the winner of the game between the players who are tied will be the winner.

The games will use AGA rules unless both players agree to use a different ruleset. 30 minutes main time with 5x30 seconds overtime.

Approximate schedule:

9:00 AM Doors open
10:00 AM First Round
11:30 AM Second Round
1:00 PM Lunch break
2:00 PM Third Round
3:30 PM Fourth Round
5:00 PM Fifth Round
6:30 PM Awards Presentation

The registration deadline is October 3rd, 2025. Space is limited, so please register early to secure your spot.

Contact Vincent if you have any further questions. See you there!

item.title: 2025 Tournament May 10
item.dc:creator: Steve
item.description:
It's time for the 2025 Calgary Go Tournament! This year, it will be a one-day affair held on May 10th.

Location: Calgary Co-op Brentwood
4122 Brentwood Rd NW
View Map
Date and Time: Saturday May 10 (9:00 AM to about 6:30 PM)
Registration: Email Vincent at studentofsmith@gmail.com with your name and rank (if known)
Entry fee: NONE!
Co-op does not charge us for use of the community room, so we have negligible costs to run the tournament.
So come have some fun and play some games!
Prizes: Fame and glory!

The tournament will have a round-robin format with 6 players per division (five rounds). Whoever has the most wins in a division will be the winner of that division. In the event of a tie the winner of the game between the players who are tied will be the winner.

The games will use AGA rules unless both players agree to use a different ruleset. 30 minutes main time with 5x30 seconds overtime.

Approximate schedule:

9:00 AM Doors open
10:00 AM First Round
11:30 AM Second Round
1:00 PM Lunch break
2:00 PM Third Round
3:30 PM Fourth Round
5:00 PM Fifth Round
6:30 PM Awards Presentation

The registration deadline is May 8th, 2025. Space is limited, so please register early to secure your spot.

Contact Vincent if you have any further questions. See you there!

item.title: Omatsuri 2025 - July 18 + 19
item.dc:creator: Steve
item.description:
The 2025 edition of the Calgary Japanese Festival Omatsuri is coming this summer! Once again, the event is spread across two days at Max Bell Centre, but this year it's happening in July.

The Calgary Go Club will be there to teach beginners the rules and help them play their first few games. This is always a fun event, and it's great spreading knowledge of the best game in the world!

  • Who
    • Anyone who wants to play or learn Go!
    • If you're interested in helping to teach, reach out to Vincent or Steve at the club.
  • When
    • Friday, July 18, 2025, 5:00 PM to 9:00 PM
    • Saturday, July 19, 2025, 10:00 AM to 5:00 PM
  • Where
    • Max Bell Centre, 1001 Barlow Trail SE (map)

As always, parking is limited and attendees should prefer to use public transit where possible.

item.title: Please bring your own equipment December 29
item.dc:creator: Steve
item.description:
Vincent will not be able to attend the meeting on December 29, 2024. He normally brings the equipment for us to all play with, so that day all players are encouraged to bring their own gear. As long as at least half of us bring a set, we'll be good to play.

Now might be a good time to show off your fancy Go board you've got at home!

item.title: All Calgary Public Library locations closed (UPDATED!)
item.dc:creator: Steve
item.description:
All Calgary Public Library locations including the Central Library are closed due to a cybersecurity breach. Source 1, Source 2

The Go Club cannot meet until the library opens again. Please check the CPL website for updates.

UPDATE - Locations will reopen Wednesday, so we can resume Go Club activity on October 20th.

item.title: Omatsuri 2024 - August 9 + 10
item.dc:creator: Steve
item.description:
The Calgary Japanese Festival Omatsuri 2024 is coming! This year's event will be spread across two days at Max Bell Centre.

The evening of Friday August 9 will have some modern events, while all day Saturday August 10 will include more traditional cultural events. The Calgary Go Club will be there the whole time for anyone that wants to learn or play Go!

  • Who
    • Anyone who wants to play or learn Go!
  • When
    • Friday, August 9, 2024, 7:00 PM to 11:00 PM
    • Saturday, August 10, 2024, 10:00 AM to 5:00 PM
  • Where
    • Max Bell Centre, 1001 Barlow Trail SE (map)

As always, parking is limited and attendees should prefer to use public transit where possible.

item.title: 2024 Tournament May 4-5 (no meeting May 5)
item.dc:creator: Steve
item.description:
The 2024 Calgary Go Tournament is upon us! We will be hosting the tournament on the weekend of May 4-5. Registration details are below, but the deadline for registration is April 30, 2024. Please register as early as you can to make planning easier.

There will be no regular club meeting May 5, as we'll be busy with the tournament.

Location: Calgary Co-op Brentwood
4122 Brentwood Rd NW
View Map
Date and Time: Saturday May 4 (9:00 AM to about 5:00 PM) and Sunday May 5 (9:00 AM to 2:00 PM)
Exact finish times will depend on how quickly the last round of the day ends.
Registration: Email Vincent at studentofsmith@gmail.com with your name and rank (if known)
Entry fee: NONE!
Co-op does not charge us for use of the community room, so we have negligible costs to run the tournament.
So come have some fun and play some games!
Prizes: Fame and glory!

The tournament format will have 5 rounds, with the exact format and divisions to be finalized by the day of the tournament. We will use AGA rules, with 45 minutes main time per side, 25 stones in 10 minutes Canadian byo-yomi.

The time table shall be approximately:

Saturday, May 4
9:00 AM Doors open
10:00 AM First Round
12:00 PM Lunch Break
1:00 PM Second Round
3:00 PM Third Round
Sunday, May 5
9:00 AM Fourth Round
11:00 PM Fifth Round
1:00 PM Awards Ceremony

Again, the registration deadline is April 30. Space is limited, so please register early to secure your spot.

Contact Vincent if you have any further questions. See you there!

item.title: Teach Go near Panorama Hills
item.dc:creator: Steve
item.description:
Calling all volunteers in the area of Panorama Hills!

The Panorama Hills Residents Association is interested in having some Go teaching sessions over the summer, mainly aimed at seniors in that community. The intent is to have some recurring sessions of teaching and games, and perhaps an informal tournament at the end of the season.

Exact location, times and dates are still to be determined, and will depend on the availability of volunteers to run the classes. Please send an email to me (evetsso at gmail.com) if you're interested! We can work out how to distribute equipment to you.
